result.execSummary:
The defendant Jason P Hoppa was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Theft-False Representation <=$2500, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.20(1)(d).
  • Theft-False Representation <=$2500, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.20(1)(d).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt: of Conviction (DOC-37) - extends probation for one year (10/25/2018)
Petition and Stipulation to Waive Appearance and Order Extending Probation for Unpaid Court Obligations - one year (10/25/2018)

1:10 p.m.  Defendant present in court without counsel.  Agent Mike Pulice present in court.  Court questions defendant regarding payment.  Statement by defendant - has paid some monies.  Court finds the defendant has made an effort but not a good faith effort and extends probation for one year.  Court informs defendant that if probation is extended again the court will fashion conditions to include jail time.  Court goes over right to counsel and how to obtain one.

Court adjourned at 1:10 p.m.
Probation review hearing on September 11, 2017 at 01:00 pm.

records.addlTxt:
2:04 p.m.  Defendant present in court with Atty Jeanne Zamzow.  Lisa Vanden Branden for the State of Wisconsin.  Statement by ADA - moves to amend count 1 & 2 to Misdemeanor Theft by Fraud with probation and counts 3 & 4 will be dismissed and read-in.  Clerk confirms restitution has been paid in full.

Court goes over plea questionnaire with the defendant.  Court goes over constitutional rights with the defendant - defendant waives these rights.  Court goes over the elements of each offense.  Court instructs defendant of the maximum penalty.  Court instructs defendant regarding deportation.

Defendant enters a plea of NO CONTEST.  Court finds the plea is made freely, voluntarily, intelligently and understandingly.  Court finds there is a factual basis to support the plea.  Court finds the defendant guilty on counts 1 & 2 as amended.  Court orders counts 3 & 4 be dismissed and read-in.  Court orders the judgment of conviction be entered here today.  ADA confirms compliance with victim witness rights.  Sentencing statement by ADA.  Sentencing statement by Atty Zamzow.  No statement by the defendant.

Court sentences the defendant to (EACH COUNT 1 & 2): 

SWD, and places the defendant on probation for 1 year.

CONDITIONS (EACH COUNT):

-Court costs.
-Defendant is to abide by all rules and recommendations of the supervising agent.
-Defendant is to submit a DNA Sample.

Court orders the restitution be paid to the victim.

Court adjourned at 2:10 p.m.
Plea/sentencing hearing on October 25, 2016 at 01:30 pm.

10:46 a.m.  Defendant present in court with Atty Jeanne Zamzow.  Andrew Christenson for the State of Wisconsin.  Statement by Atty Zamzow - scheduled for an arraignment today and defendant is working on paying the restitution.  

Attorney Zamzow and defendant acknowledge receipt of the information and waives any reading.  Atty Zamzow enters a plea of Not Guilty on behalf of the defendant.  Court will set for Plea & Sentencing on October 25, 2016 at 1:30 p.m..

Court adjourned at 10:48 a.m.
Arraignment on August 30, 2016 at 10:30 am.

12:06 P.M.  No appearance by the defendant.  Attorney Jeanne Zamzow present.  Andrew Christenson for the State of Wisconsin.  Statement by Atty Zamzow - does not know where the defendant is.  Statement by the Court.  Court sets for Arraignmant on August 30, 2016 at 10:30 a.m.

Court adjourned at 12:09 p.m.
State's
Arraignment on August 1, 2016 at 11:00 am.

11:54 A.M.  Defendant present in court with Atty Jeanne Zamzow.  Lisa Vanden Branden for the State of Wisconsin.  Statement by Atty Zamzow - defendant will waive the preliminary hearing.  Defendant concurs.  Court instructs the defendant regarding his right to a preliminary examination.  Defendant waives his right to a preliminary examination.  Court accepts the waiver of the prelim and binds the defendant over for trial. 

Court sets for Arraigment on August 1, 2016 at 11:00 a.m.

Court adjourned at 11:56 a.m.
Preliminary hearing on July 5, 2016 at 11:30 am.
Preliminary hearing on June 21, 2016 at 11:30 am.

10:54 a.m.  Defendant present in court with Atty Jeanne Zamzow.  Andrew Christenson for the State of Wisconsin.  Statement by Atty Zamzow - defendant requests a preliminary hearing.  Court sets for prelim on June 21, 2016 at 11:30 a.m. 

Court adjourned at 10:54 a.m.

10:21 a.m.  Defendant present in court with Atty Jeanne Zamzow.  Lisa Vanden Branden for the State of Wisconsin.  Statement by Atty Zamzow - sent an email to the ADA regarding offer in this case and have not heard back.  Court adjourns for Atty Zamzow to discuss the prelim with the defendant.

Court adjourned at 10:23 a.m.
